questions.question: filter cells to retain only Obese BMI Category entries, then extract the mean sleep duration values for each stress level to quantify the stress-sleep duration relationship in this group.

answer.value: sleep duration decreases as stress level rises, with a linear negative correlation.

key_insights: For Obese individuals, sleep duration decreases as stress level rises, with a linear negative correlation.
Stress Level 1 for Obese individuals has the highest mean sleep duration among their subgroup, nearly matching Normal BMI Category at low stress levels.

reasoning.reasoning: Filtering isolates the Obese subgroup to eliminate confounding variables from other BMI categories, enabling a focused analysis of stress-sleep duration relationships
converts the filtered visual subset into quantifiable data, resolving the gap between visual pattern and numerical comparison.
